00002 #
00003 #  Implement functions having two real inputs
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Function::numeric2;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Function);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check for two real-valued arguments
00011 #
00012 sub _check {
00013   my $self = shift;
00014   return if ($self->checkArgCount(2));
00015   if (($self->{params}->[0]->isNumber && $self->{params}->[1]->isNumber &&
00016       !$self->{params}->[0]->isComplex && !$self->{params}->[1]->isComplex) ||
00017       $self->context->flag("allowBadFunctionInputs")) {
00018     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{number};
00019   } else {
00020     $self->Error("Function '%s' has the wrong type of inputs",$self->{name});
00021   }
00022 }
00023 
00024 #
00025 #  Check that the inputs are OK
00026 #
00027 sub _call {
00028   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00029   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too many inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) > 2;
00030   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too few inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) < 2;
00031   Value::Error("Function '%s' has the wrong type of inputs",$name)
00032     unless Value::matchNumber($_[0]) && Value::matchNumber($_[1]);
00033   return $self->$name(@_);
00034 }
00035 
00036 #
00037 #  Call the appropriate routine
00038 #
00039 sub _eval {
00040   my $self = shift; my $name = $self->{name};
00041   $self->$name(@_);
00042 }
00043 
00044 #
00045 #  Do the core atan2 call
00046 #
00047 sub atan2 {shift; CORE::atan2($_[0],$_[1])}
